Objective: Confirm simple match works and locked lines cannot be rematched
Preconditions: Deposit has one Unmatched line and one matching schedule
Test_Steps: Open deposit | Select 1 line + 1 schedule | Click Match | Retry on reconciled or ignored line
Expected_Result: Unmatched line matches successfully; reconciled/ignored lines are blocked with clear errors
Risk_Reason: Core 1:1 apply path and lock guards are implemented.
Agent Assesment: API explicitly blocks reconciled/ignored lines and applies allocations with recompute/audit.

Objective: Confirm matching works with missing address when IDs exist
Preconditions: Deposit line has missing address but valid Order ID or Customer ID
Test_Steps: Open deposit | Select line | Review candidates | Apply match
Expected_Result: Candidate appears based on IDs/name/amount/date; match applies without requiring address
Risk_Reason: Matching signals rely on IDs/names/amount/date; address is not a hard gate.
Agent Assesment: Order/customer/account/location/PO signals can still produce candidates when address data is missing.

Objective: Validate one line can be split across multiple schedules
Preconditions: One deposit line and 2+ eligible schedules available
Test_Steps: Select 1 line + multiple schedules | Click Match | Confirm detected type 1:M | Enter allocations | Run preview | Apply
Expected_Result: Wizard opens as 1:M; over-allocation blocked; apply succeeds as one match group
Risk_Reason: 1:M detection, preview validation, and apply endpoints are implemented.
Agent Assesment: Match-type classification plus wizard preview/apply path is wired for non-1:1.

Objective: Validate multiple lines can allocate to one schedule
Preconditions: Multiple deposit lines and one eligible schedule available
Test_Steps: Select multiple lines + 1 schedule | Click Match | Confirm detected type M:1 | Choose Allocate | Preview | Apply
Expected_Result: Wizard opens as M:1; running totals reflect many lines to one schedule; status/variance updates correctly
Risk_Reason: M:1 detection and allocation flow are implemented with preview checks.
Agent Assesment: Wizard supports ManyToOne with allocation rows and grouped apply behavior.

Objective: Validate bundle creation and replacement behavior
Test_Steps: Open M:1 wizard | Choose Bundle (Rip & Replace) | Set mode soft_delete_old | Create bundle schedules | Continue preview/apply
Expected_Result: New products/schedules are created; flow transitions into allocation; old schedules are soft-deleted only when eligible
Risk_Reason: Bundle path has strict prerequisites and validation constraints.
Agent Assesment: Implemented with guardrails: requires >=2 lines, valid base schedule link/date, non-ignored/non-reconciled/non-negative lines.

Objective: Ensure different commission rates are not silently blended
Preconditions: Test data includes schedules/lines with differing effective commission rates
Test_Steps: Run bundle + apply match | Validate expected usage/commission per created schedule | Repeat with mismatch candidate visibility check
Expected_Result: Each schedule keeps correct commission math; no incorrect blended rate; any visibility suppression is captured as defect
Risk_Reason: No explicit rate-mismatch blocking logic observed for bundle/multi-match.
Agent Assesment: Bundle creation uses base product commission percent and derived schedule math; non-blending behavior must be manually verified.

Objective: Validate checkdown/collections path for underpaid state
Test_Steps: Create partial allocation | Confirm Underpaid status | Attempt to launch collections/checkdown action
Expected_Result: Underpaid status is visible; collections/checkdown action exists or gap is documented
Risk_Reason: Collections/checkdown workflow appears not implemented yet.
Agent Assesment: Underpaid status exists, but dedicated collections launch path is likely missing or incomplete.

Objective: Verify dependent values recalculate after schedule updates
Preconditions: Editable schedule is available in manage/edit flow
Test_Steps: Update Quantity and Price Each | Update commission rate | Update adjustments | Save | Refresh
Expected_Result: Expected Usage and Expected Commission recalculate consistently; no stale values after refresh
Risk_Reason: Single-record recalculation is stronger than bulk recalculation path.
Agent Assesment: Single schedule update recomputes expected usage/commission; bulk update has known limitations and expectedCommissionAdjustment is not persisted.

Test_Steps: Open Manage Revenue Schedules | Use Change Start Date | Set new date Feb 1 | Provide reason | Apply | Verify sequence
Expected_Result: Dates shift by one month while preserving cadence; reason required; missing tab is logged as blocker/gap
Risk_Reason: Change Start Date tab is not present in current Manage modal tabs.
Agent Assesment: Feature exists in planning docs but is not implemented in active Manage UI.

Preconditions: User has manage permissions and selected schedules
Test_Steps: Open Manage Revenue Schedules | Test Change Commission Rate | Test Change Commission Split | Test date action if available | Apply updates
Expected_Result: Updates persist for selected schedules only; audit/history is present; derived values remain consistent
Risk_Reason: Manage supports rate/split/status/undo, but date-shift is missing and some recalculation paths are incomplete.
Agent Assesment: Rate and split endpoints exist; date-change action is absent and some bulk-derived recalculation expectations may fail.

Objective: Validate selected row carry-over into popup tabs
Preconditions: Schedules are pre-selected on Opportunity > Revenue Schedules
Test_Steps: Select schedules on parent page | Open Manage Revenue Schedules | Inspect tab selection state
Expected_Result: Previously selected rows carry into relevant tabs; missing carry-over is logged as UX defect
Risk_Reason: Selection prefill is scoped to status/deactivate-delete behavior, not generalized.
Agent Assesment: Current prop (`initialStatusSelection`) seeds status selection rather than all tabs/actions.

Preconditions: At least one no-match or overage line available
Test_Steps: Select no-match line | Trigger Create Flex Product | Open resolution flow | Test one-time and recurring options
Expected_Result: Flex item/schedule is created; resolution flow supports required choices and downstream behavior
Risk_Reason: Flex create and resolve flows are implemented with action branching.
Agent Assesment: Create-flex endpoint and flex-review resolve actions (ApplyToExisting/ConvertToRegular/BonusCommission) are present.

Preconditions: Active-billing opportunity product with no schedule in target month
Test_Steps: Trigger month-to-month process in test env | Verify created schedule for target month | Re-run check for duplicates
Expected_Result: One schedule is created when criteria are met; no duplicate when target month already exists
Risk_Reason: Execution depends on job auth and strict product/status preconditions.
Agent Assesment: Job endpoint requires `x-job-secret` and only processes `ActiveBilling` products lacking target-month schedule.

Objective: Validate negative-line handling, In Dispute status, and manager approval path
Preconditions: Negative deposit line and manager account available
Test_Steps: Create/upload negative line | Reconcile | Verify In Dispute | Manager approve/reject | Add reversal line | Reconcile
Expected_Result: Chargeback schedule (-CB) created; manager action path available; reversal (-CB-REV) created and auditable
Risk_Reason: Approval endpoint is restricted to ADMIN role, which may differ from business 'Manager' expectation.
Agent Assesment: Negative lines route to chargeback flows and approvals exist, but permission model can block non-admin manager users.

Objective: Validate rollback safety for match group, bundle, and allocation undo
Preconditions: Applied match group and bundle scenario available
Test_Steps: Apply non-1:1 group | Undo Match Group | In bundle scenario run Undo bundle | In Manage popup use Remove Allocation
Expected_Result: Rollback restores aggregates correctly; audit trail includes who/when/what/reason; bundle undo blocked when dependencies remain
Risk_Reason: Undo endpoints are implemented with safety checks and recompute logic.
Agent Assesment: Match-group undo, line unmatch, and bundle undo exist; bundle undo correctly blocks when created schedules already have applied matches.

Objective: Validate total/subtotal rows are not imported
Preconditions: Upload file includes data rows plus Total/SubTotal/Grand Total rows
Test_Steps: Run multi-vendor upload | Run single-vendor upload | Compare imported row count vs expected non-total rows
Expected_Result: Total/subtotal rows are ignored and not imported as line items; any single-vendor leak is logged as defect
Risk_Reason: Totals skipping is explicit for multi-vendor parsing but not clearly enforced in single-vendor import mapping loop.
Agent Assesment: Multi-vendor preview/grouping uses totals-skip helper; single-vendor path primarily filters by usage/commission null checks.

Objective: Validate behavior with incomplete onboarding data
Preconditions: Files prepared for missing opportunity, missing mapping, missing IDs, mixed quality rows
Test_Steps: Import each level as separate deposit | Attempt matching/flex handling | Capture warnings/blocks/routes
Expected_Result: System does not crash; behavior is actionable (match where possible, exception path when not); warnings/errors are clear
Risk_Reason: Behavior is resilient but heavily dependent on mapping/template/account data quality.
Agent Assesment: Core flows should not hard-crash; expect more exception routing, warning handling, and manual triage in sparse-data onboarding cases.
